Hi Kerbals

I have a littele Problem in my game. I built a Space Station looking like this

| |

o-o-o

(Formatting doesn't work like i thought - basically ist is looking like an "U" from the front.)

where the lines are modules and the "o"s are docking ports.

Now i have the Problem that the station is twisted a bit in the middle dock, so from the side it's lokking a bit like a V...

Is it somehow possible to align the 2 halfs perfectly, so that it looks like "|" from the side?

Thanks in advance

Wayan
The only way possible to do that is to undock, then redock correctly.
The Q and E rotate the craft (depending on how yours controls) but you will need to undock first then rotate and re-dock.
I thought so, but with the controls it is really difficult to hit the angle perfectly....

I thought so, but with the controls it is really difficult to hit the angle perfectly....

I had to do it with my Stations Solar Arrays, and they are MASSIVE
In the future try making a multi port connection and that will ensure alignment.
Lazor Docking Cam Mod and chase view... made of sexy - also I love "quantum struts" strut gun to lock things on once you have it docked.

i think mechjeb 2 aligns perfectly. cant guaranty it though. yes i suggest using multiple docking ports as wel. if you have 2.5m parts as your central section you could cluster 4 docking ports on that., just make sure they are perfectly spaced, use subassembly saver
